text: The northern cricket frog (Acris crepitans) is a species of small Hylid frogs. They live in Canada, the United States and northeastern Mexico. Northern cricket frogs are small frogs, between 0.75 and 1.5 inches (19â€“38 mm) long. They have pink color on their throats. They eat crickets and small insects. They usually lay eggs in April through May. Tadpoles hatch within a few days. == References == ==Other websites== *Animal Diversity Web: Acris crepitans *USGS: Northern Cricket Frog *Frogs & Toads of Georgia: Acris crepitans crepitans Category:Frogs of North America
title: Northern cricket frog
